intro: Trichosanthes sericeifolia, commonly known as the silver-haired栝蒌, is a climbing vine native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces striking yellow flowers followed by orange, fleshy fruits that are edible when mature. Its botanical features make it a notable species in traditional medicine and horticulture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas.
